TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant , who is a taxi driver by profession , was involved in a traffic accident .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was charged with causing the accident . On DATE the applicant was served with a bill of indictment .

CARDINAL . The hearing set for DATE was adjourned due to the presiding judge ’s illness . On DATE ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) held the first hearing in the case . The hearing set for DATE was adjourned due to the ORG absence .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court ordered an expert opinion to be obtained . On DATE the expert submitted his opinion to the court . The court ordered a supplementary opinion to be obtained .
CARDINAL . The hearing set for DATE was adjourned . At the hearing held on DATE the GPE ORG gave judgment . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) quashed the firstinstance judgment and remitted the case .
CARDINAL . Following the remittal , on DATE the GPE ORG gave judgment . The court sentenced the applicant to DATE imprisonment stayed for DATE . The applicant appealed .

CARDINAL . The applicant filed a complaint with ORG under LAW DATE on complaints about a breach of the right to a trial within a reasonable time ( “ CARDINAL Act ” ) . On DATE ORG gave a decision and confirmed that the proceedings had indeed been lengthy . However , the court did not grant any compensation to the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held an appeal hearing and gave judgment . The judgment is final .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again filed a complaint with ORG under LAW alleging that a copy of the final judgment had not yet been served on him . ORG rejected the complaint , on a later unknown date , as the applicant had never asked to be served with a copy of the final judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant for the third time filed a complaint with ORG under LAW . On DATE the court refused to deal with the merits of the complaint . The court held that the proceedings had already been terminated and therefore the complaint was groundless .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings are stated in the ORG ’s decisions in the cases of ORG v. GPE no . CARDINAL ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL , ORG CARDINALV and PERSON v. GPE no . CARDINAL ( dec . ) , ORG CARDINALVIII and its judgment in the case of ORG v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL
